intro: Stephanomeria parryi, commonly known as Parry's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its spherical, woolly seed heads that resemble small globes, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as grasslands and open woodlands. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Stephanomeria parryi is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus.
